Summary: First of all, when we arrived, there was no one at the front desk to check us in, so we waited approximately 10 minutes before I called the hotel‚Äôs phone number. A gentleman answered (it must have been a cell phone because you could tell he was in the car), he did not apologize for the inconvenience, all he said was ‚Äúhold on. I‚Äôll be there in a minute‚Äù which I felt was rude and unprofessional. But that wasn‚Äôt what upset me. We ended up waiting another 20 minutes, so THIRTY MINUTES total from the time we got to the hotel, to the time he arrived. Mind you, this was not an odd time‚Äîit was around 3:00 in the afternoon. When the gentleman finally arrived, he did not apologize, nor try to explain where he was or why he kept us waiting. Unacceptable.   It gets worse.  He finally

I stay in San Clemente many times and i thought i'd try this Hotel.  The advertising is deceiving.   They advertise down comforters, not true.  they advertise ocean view.  Not really.  The bed sank.  the pillows were hard.  the TV worked but not the sound. Worst of all is there was NO HOT WATER.    No shower before heading back to the office.
Manager Response: HI Sheryl,   Thank you for posting the same review on three different websites. I am deeply sorry for what you experienced at our property. I have discussed your stay with our team and they wish you would of contacted us during your stay so we could made it better. The items you have listed are not up to our standards and we will use this review as a teaching moment for our staff. Thank you for writing a review so we can better ourselves.   Best,  GM

Summary: This is our second stay here in as many weeks.  My husband and I stayed here a few nights before going on a cruise. The rooms and furnishings are very cozy. Can't say enough about the heavenly mattress! But, the cleanliness of the room was very sub par. When we checked in we were warmly welcomed and he told us the place is under renovations,  so we gave them a lot of grace. But DON'T walk barefoot on the carpet in your room..... filthy!  After our cruise we needed a place for a couple of nights before catching our plane back to Alaska.  Why did we come back to this place? Lots of reasons.  First and foremost we were treated well by all the workers we came in contact with.  That is a very big deal. Second,  the location is fantastic! And last (but not least) the price is
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review and your stay at our hotel. We have done lots of remodeling including changing of the mattresses. We do our best to provide clean rooms. If it is not up to your standards and you have issues then please let us know and we will do our best to correct the issue. The owner has been informed about the coffee makers. Thank you and we look forward to your next stay.

Summary: My daughter and I stayed for 4 nights. We were supposed to stay for 5 nights but the night we got there the office was closed so we couldnt check in. I called just after 10 when we landed in Los Angelos and got no answer so we just drove down hoping they would be there. I had left a message when I called. So this was a huge hassle for us. So be warned they do roll up the sidewalks and close the office at this hotel. Late night check in is imperative to let them know. Other than this we loved the hotel and location. Bed was comfy, pillows not so much. Too fat and hard.
Room tip: 3rd floor good view of the strip of ocean.
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest. We are sorry you were disappointed with the issue you experienced with your first impression of our facility and we regret the inconvenience it caused. We also apologize that you did not get a response from the front desk when leaving your call. Your feedback is important to us, and we will use it to improve our services going forward. On a positive note, we are glad to know you appreciated our well-kept property. We value your business and hope you both will give us another chance to provide you with a better experience.

Summary: Enjoyed our 2 night stay.  Weather was great.  The inn is small ... 18 rooms total.  Nice 3 floors.  3 minute drive to the ocean pier.  Easy quick freeway access!   Quiet and nice seating area on each floor with umbrellas.   Tight parking for our truck but no issues getting into a spot though.  Workers were nice.  Quick check in.   Not a resort but nice break from hustle and bustle in a clean basic room in a cute inn near so many things.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback. We're thrilled you enjoyed your stay and found your room clean and comfortable and our front desk helpful and courteous. We value your business and we look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: My husband and I had reservations for three nights. 1st. day we come back to our room. No room service so we go down to the office and it's locked up. So we figure maybe we didn't put the maid sign on the door ( which I shouldn't have to do to get our room cleaned and towels. 2nd day we come back late, once again no room service. We go down to talked to the attendent.  He gives us attitude. He asks us did we put the hang tag on the door. We say yes. He said" I don't know what happened. The outside looks like a beautiful hotel inside... not so nice. Service Zero!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your recent stay while you were here on a vacation. We are sorry we fell short of your expectations during your visit. Your feedback regarding your stay has been shared with appropriate team members. We hope you will consider staying with us again so we might serve you better in the future.

Summary: Classic Californina beach town small hotel.  Cute and pleasant, good location.  AC worked fine.  Beds very comfortable but pillows too thick and firm to sleep with without getting neck ache.  WiFi very weak and non functional much of the time.  Room was clean but in need of upgrading---especially carpet and  bathroom floor tile. Onsite parking was available but quite tight during mid-week; On weekend parking lot was full at night with only option being street parking. Hotel was informal and adequate.
Manager Response: Thank you for recommending us. We appreciate your feedback and we hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back next time your in the area.

Summary: my wife and i stayed here during the 4th of July. What a nice place to relax. close drive to the beach. from check in to check out, i would recommend this place 100%. rooms are very clean, very nice people, real quiet, even during the holidays
Manager Response: Thank you bikerkenny for your great review of your stay at The Little Inn by the Beach. We appreciate you recommending us 100% and we look forward to welcoming you and your wife back again soon!

Summary: First of all, it is not ‚Äòby the beach‚Äô.  The name is misleading.  It is located to the East of the Interstate 5 and one mile from the closest beach.  If you go to the third floor, you can see part of the ocean.  You are close to the highway so the noise it is loud when you are outside, however newer windows were very good at minimizing the road noise inside the room.  The rooms and furnishings are older, and some things were less than perfect.  For example, we found the fridge, microwave, and one lamp unplugged, a TV remote control missing, a loose toilet seat, and there were no extra blankets left by the time we checked in.  The bathroom tiles could have been a little cleaner.  Parking is tight, and there is only enough room for one car per room.  Housekeeping service was quite
Room tip: Rooms on the 3d floor have the a slight ocean view.  The balcony is a good place to bring your...
Manager Response: We are delighted you had an excellent stay at the Little Inn by the Beach . It is a pleasure to know how much you liked our outstanding location and value for price. Thank you for your recommendations, and we look forward to welcoming you again the next time you are in our city.

Summary: Nice little Hotel, within walking distance of the beach. I was traveling alone, visiting a friend. We walked in the neighborhood, it felt reasonably safe. I recommend walking, or using a ride share, to get to the beach. It is hard to find a parking spot, if you take your vehicle. I think there's buses that run, down to the beach as well.  Lots of great food in the hood as well.  Seafood is really the way to go, when on the left coast.
Room tip: Lots of dining to walk to!
Manager Response: We are delighted you had an excellent stay at the Little Inn by the Beach, San Clemente, Ca. It is a pleasure to know how much you liked our outstanding location and friendly service. Thank you for your recommendations, and we look forward to welcoming you again the next time you are in our city.

Summary: Loved this quaint inn! Very friendly staff, very clean room. They were always fixing things up or painting to keep it new and fresh. Extended our stay two extra nights bc we loved it so much. Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest. We are happy to know you enjoyed your stay and that you were impressed with our hardworking associates and well-equipped accommodations. We value your business and hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary Heading: Charming Inn close to Everything in San Clemente
Summary: Get a 3rd floor room for a view of the ocean, sunrises and sunsets.  Not fancy but with great character, we loved it.  Clean, comfortable room with great shower and good bed.  We slept refreshed and ready to explore! Right on the PCH and just off the I-5, close the door and lose the 21st century.   Not 10 minutes to historic downtown, the beach or innumerable shops on the PCH.  Quiet room, massive armoir in the King James style (jk) and a bamboo theme.  Room to play cards or enjoy a drink or takeout.  Best of all, the price is right.
Manager Response: RushCubFan, thank you for recommending The San Clemente Little Inn by the Beach, San Clemente, Ca. We're delighted you found our hotel to be a good value and that you enjoyed the many facilities available at your service. Thanks again for recognizing our efforts. We look forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: We found a great deal for this place when we got to San Clemente after a day at sea at Dana Point on route to San Diego.  The check in was straight forward and staff friendly, and the room was what you would expect at price.  Retro wall paper and bedding was a bonus.  Coming from NZ we appreciate a bit of character!  The freeway is loud, but it‚Äôs what you would expect.  It didn‚Äôt bother us, but main criticism would be need for blank out curtains, and needs a deep clean- AC visibly grubby.  But otherwise great.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback in regards to your stay at The San Clemente Little Inn By The Beach. I'm glad to read that check in was straight forward and our staff was friendly also that you felt your room was comfortable. We look forward to hosting you in the future. Thank you for your business.

Summary Heading: Great place at this price point
Summary: I stayed here with a friend overnight while attending the Ohana festival in Dana Point.  The price was right, and we were delighted with the cleanliness and unexpected amenities in the room.  It‚Äôs a very cute, kind of retro inn.  The front desk was person was friendly and helpful. There were books and dvds in the small lobby as well.  The beds were very squeaky but I found it comfortable for sleeping and I always bring my own pillow so I can‚Äôt speak to that.   We did not try the continental breakfast so I can‚Äôt speak to that either.   It is very close to interstate 5 but that didn‚Äôt bother me and the fact that it‚Äôs on El Camino Real makes it convenient and close to restaurants, bars, shopping etc.   We will definitely stay here again next year :-)
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. It was a pleasure having you as our guest and we look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit. Maybe next time you will stay for breakfast!

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at The Little Inn.  I will say I was a bit nervous, after reading some of the reviews, but we found this to be a quaint hotel with all that we needed to enjoy our time in San Clemente.  The bed was super comfortable (the sheets seemed new and fresh), the A/C worked great, and I liked the variety of $2 snacks in the room.  The inn keeper was incredibly helpful and seemed genuinely glad to have us staying.  There is a little patio set with an umbrella on each level of the motel, which made for an enjoyable place to have some wine and snacks (with a very distant view of the ocean). This hotel is very close to the freeway, but the noise didn't bother us.  It's about a 20-25 minute walk to the beach, so you might be best off driving.    This is not a 4 star
Manager Response: Thank you for being our recent guest at The Little Inn by the Beach, San Clemente, Ca. I'm glad to know that you found your bed super comfortable and our location is convenient for you. Thank you for your business and we look forward to welcoming you back again.

Summary Heading: Clean old style hotel in San Clemente
Summary: San Clemente Little Inn by the Beach is a throwback to family run motels of several decades ago...if it had had a magic fingers chair ($0.25) it would have been a perfect copy.  This is a clean, comfortable 2.5 star hotel.  Although the name says ‚Äúby the beach‚Äù, it is actually a 15 minute walk away, located between a busy street and the freeway.  I was quickly checked in at the small office next to the (free) parking lot; the office opens at 8:30 AM so is not always staffed..  My room was on the second (but actually third) floor. The keys are the old-style and still identify the room number on the plastic key-fob.  All of the rooms open onto a balcony overlooking the parking.  The room was larger than normal with a ‚Äútiki‚Äù theme and had a little beach-musty smell.  There was a

The staff was friendly but the motel itself is not great. The beds were hard as a rock. The pillows, flat like a pancake. Linens, itchy. The windows were so thin and the 5 freeway was coming right into our room. the beds, pillows, and windows weren't the only things keeping us awake; the outdoor lighting shines right through the blinds. Needs severe renovation, new beds, blackout curtains and more

Summary Heading: Time capsule- not in a good way
Summary: We stopped here on our way to San Diego. The front desk was very hard to get a hold of, and the room was very dated. The floor was damp, the pillows flat, and the beds terribly uncomfortable. While it was clean, would not stop again.

I have stayed here several times. The location is good, and while it is dated,it is very clean, the price is good for the area and the hospitality made it pleasant.  This year was a different story. The water smelled like sulphur, you could see through the toilet paper, the wifi was very spotty, our TV remote didn't work and there was no help until the next day., and the beds are badly in need of replacement. And adding insult to injury, when we returned from an evening out we found that the street was closed for construction and we had to take a detour.  It would have been appreciated if this information had been passed on.

To sum this place up: out of date non maintained version of a motel. Shower: broken Linens: stained Staff: not helpfull  We got a new room because the linen was stained. New room had the same sort of stains. Again: new room. We went back to the lobby, got looked at funny. But come on: who wants stained sheets in any sort of motel. And even worse: now the shower didn't work properly.   All in all a poorly executed version of a wanna be motel. Seen hostels that were better sorted.

Location is outstanding.....Nothing else good to say.  Showed up....NO clerk, ended up getting key from barmaid next door,  no help upstairs with luggage, Bathroom old with missing fixtures and broken tile, linens with worn through areas, no clerk at check out-just left key and escaped.

If you're a fan of time travel, this hotel is for you!  Go back 47 years to a hotel that has no interest in updating its decor or furniture.  I left a list of 12 things that were defective during our stay.  Peeling wallpaper, uneven floor, specks of mold in the shower, loose toilet seat, loose toilet paper roll holder, loud A/C, etc.  Ugly pink buckets outside each A/C unit to catch condensation.  Outside patios were nice, but beach is a long ways away, and certainly isn't BY the beach.  Nice beds, though!

Simplistic, clean, convenient access to freeway, price is right!  Hop on freeway and Califa beach is first exit away!  Pros: price, cleanliness, ease of check in/out.   Cons: "ocean view"  includes current construction and the freeway, parking limited.

Pretty nice motel and nice staff...just bugged by the other visitors!  We were in a 1st floor room and the idiots above us got home at midnight and woke up to surf at 4am.  We could literally hear every step and it sounded like the place was going to cave in, every flush of the toilet, and dripping for 20 min after they were done showering.  It woke up every person in the family, PM and AM.  We were next to the gross old 'scoop' ice machine (which was actually pretty clean, the idea of it just made me sick) and got woken up by loud scooping at night. Cool little balcony with tables and chairs outside of our room (5 feet from our door), but they allowed smoking, so our non-smoking room became a smoking one real quick.  Plus the 'up' button on the A/C was broken, so our room was

Arrived at 11 am. Luis at the desk let me into my room on the third floor right away. Room clean and comfortable with ocean view - marred only by the freeway running between the hotel and the sea! All in all very quiet, pleasant and so affordable:)

The hotel was small and certainly not near the beach. The room was okay though small. It was very close to the highway so could, at times, be noisy. The staff was pleasant. Probably would not stay here again though the price was good.

Summary Heading: Maybe check a few other places
Summary: The hotel has good down hill a bit since our stay there last summer.  First the good...The location of the hotel is great.  Only a couple of miles from the pier and beach.  Good places for breakfast and lunch within walking distance.  I highly recommend SC Cafe across the street. The gentleman who checked us in recognized us from a previous stay and gave us a generous discount for being a return customer. He was always conscientious and on top of anything that was brought to his attention.  We had trouble with the TV the first night. Brought it to the attention of another employee who said she would let management know. Long story short, it wasn't resolved until I complained to the gentleman who checked us in.  The WiFi in our room was pretty bad; it kept cutting in and out,

First the good stuff: I like the look of this place and the room had a pleasant feel to it. I had a king bed, everything was clean, a very spacious room with a microwave and a fridge that actually kept things cold. Front desk was helpful and pleasant. Having a table and chairs on the deck-type area on each floor outside your room is nice and not something you find everywhere. It's located within a mix of residential and local businesses which I think is a big plus. Across the street you can get coffee, donuts, breakfast sandwiches, and croissants at Surfin' Donuts. Down the street is a good Mexican restaurant, El Mariachi, and Hapa J's restaurant not far from that (they have a great Hawaiian root beer and good Happy Hour). All these are within easy walking distance.  The

Close to freeway, a bit noisy,  but didn't seem to bother our sleep much. We knew for the price it wasn't going to be the Ritz, however, it appeared as though it wasn't  really cleaned very well... Like a good deep clean, just more wiped downed. Wi-fi never worked well, toilet seat was wobbly, coffee pot malfunctioned and went everywhere, one of the drawers on the TV stand was broken, and also had a strong musty odor. Also, no one at the front desk before 8:30, so hopefully you won't need anything in the early morning hours. And regardless of any website, they have NO CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: A good place to meet friends.
Summary: We were visiting in Southern California and needed a place to meet some friends that live a ways north of where we had been and decided on the Little Inn by the Beach.  It's an older motel that has been remodeled and updated.  Just off the freeway made it convenient since we know nothing about the area.  Several dining choices in the immediate area made it easy to walk rather than having to drive.  Staff was friendly;  rooms were clean and comfortable.  We'd stay there again.

I was staying here for 3 nights. Close to beach, good size room, close to all nearby places. No breakfast due to county issues. Cheap stay for ocean vacation. Beautiful beaches near by (Dana Point, Salt Creek park and Laguna Beach), nice Pier.

I came in after a long day of golf, exuasted and needing some rest. Then while me and my wife were sleeping well, the motel attendant called my room at 10:30 pm to tell me I had to reposition my cars parking because my tire was on the line. Is that incredibly stupid or what. Never again.

We have stayed at nearly every hotel in san clemente over the past year and this would be our second favorite.  Clean, nice owners who care.  Nice rooms.  Location is on east side of freeway though and you can't walk to beach or downtown.  We would stay again though.

We booked one night here to be close to Dana Point, as we were taking the boat to Catalina the next day.  There was a problem with the room we booked (a leak of some kind), so they needed to put us in a room with only one king, instead of 2 queen beds.  The staff was very apologetic, helpful and friendly.  They ended up giving us a roll away bed and adjusted the amount we paid for the inconvenience.  The room was clean and maintained.  Only complaint is that the continental breakfast didn't start until late (I think it was 8:30), so we were not able to take advantage of that.  But I would stay here again.

The place is tiny but is well kept-up.  Somewhat noisy from both street traffic and people chatting on the veranda outside the room.  Numerous little amenities.  Good size refrigerator; microwave with coffee setup.  Light, free breakfast at the front desk.  Interesting decoration.  Internet a tad slow, but free.  Parking a little limited; might have to park on the street.  Pleasant front desk staff.

It's a tiny little motel within a stone's throw of the beach- nothing extravagant or sexy, but extremely well kept. The room had everything you would need for an extended stay and all was in good working order and clean.  I'm keeping them in mind next time im around to save me some money compared to Dana Point or Laguna.  Downside?  There's a good bit of traffic noise, but it didn't keep me from getting to sleep!

Summary Heading: Air - A Necessity! YES.  Great Air.
Summary: It was clean and a little dated but overall very good.  It had very good air in our room and that is a necessity when I stay in a motel.  The reference made to a snack basket in room is one that you must have money to take part in.  Very nice staff!

Summary Heading: For the price you can't beat it
Summary: Spent one night here after hanging with friends on my birthday...for the price the room was clean and nice...friendly service as well..not a place if you have finicky accommodation tastes but great if you're okay with a non pricey lodging

Summary Heading: If I could give this a 3 & a 1/2, I would! Good room for the price!!
Summary: We enjoyed a 3-day stay here last month. This is a quaint older Hotel with personality. No pool but all the basics and nice folks working there, all of whom seem to really care about taking care of the property. Yes, it needs a little updating but the bath is spotless (tile, floors, sinks, etc.) & the bed & bath linens are very good & clean & fresh. The carpet in our room needed cleaning but otherwise very clean and excellent for the price.  The Office Managers (Luis and also Tina) were very professional, patient, & welcoming, they took time to answer questions & give directions, "Thanks so much to you both!" The maintenance folks are nice, great attitudes, they obviously do a great job. The beach is a nice long walk away & where we spent most days. Each room opens onto a shared

Stayed 4 nights, the king size bed was hard as a rock, the pillows were flat as pancakes.  You had one fluffy towel the other was so thin you could see through.  The continental breakfast was breads, coffee sometime fruit it didn't start until 8:30am nothing available until then. I believe our room was never vacuumed during my visit.

Summary Heading: Clean room, quiet location, good value
Summary: Stayed here over the 4th of July weekend. The room was clean and had the nice surprise of both a whirlpool bathtub and a door that lead out to a little patio area. Absolutely perfect for a summer night. Our room was on the 3rd floor and overlooked the courtyard, which was quiet and relaxing.  Good parking and location.

Not much parking, but big clean rooms. Firm beds. Clean sheets. Fairly quiet. Carpets were dirty (take your shoes off & see). Only one trash can. Came with plenty of towels, soap, and shampoo. Walking distance to food, shopping, and beach.  USMC base close by.

Tina, the manager, welcomed me by phone and graciously answered my questions. This is not a corporate, cookie cutter hotel but a charming little inn which harkens back to a gentler time in California when hotel rooms were unlocked with keys which turned in the lock rather than those programmed little cards. This is a family hotel with a view of the ocean. We took our breakfast up to the first floor balcony and watched the breeze dance through the eucalyptus leaves, making them appear to shimmer in the sun.

Summary Heading: Fun decor and friendly staff, thats about it
Summary: Lovely atmosphere about the place, but was a quite dirty. Can tell it hadn't had a good clean in a while, just simple wipe downs. There was grime all around the taps etc. Pillows were bad also. Wifi didn't work.

We stayed here 8 days and it was absolutely fine!  It is right next to the 5 but we didn't hear it. They have a little breakfast - bananas, oranges, power bars, Capri Suns, coffee and hot water.  The breakfast isn't ready till 8:30 but right across the street is Surf Donuts. It's about a mile and a half to the San Clemente Pier.  Great value and clean.

We rate this hotel experience as terrible.  Room was not clean.  Lack of towels, flat pillows, dirty floors and not vacuumed.  Bathtub dirty and tub mat had holes.  Bright lights outside shined into the room at night making it difficult to sleep.  TV Cable was not working.  Management is nice and friendly, but housekeeping is poor service.  After complaining to management some improvements were made.

I was at the end of my rope, ready to dive into the deep end when my husband said I could  find a nice getaway. I used to live in Dana Point so i know the area is heaven. i just needed an escape and the price was right! We booked it, packed our bags and got the hell out of town! As we approached I noticed it was not near the beach but near the 5 freeway. This must have been why it was such a deal. I was ready to bail but we did not come here to sit in our hotel room so we checked in and tried it out. The room was big, clean and comfy for the price. We hit the sites and the rest is history. I would give this spot a 4.75 if I could. We went out and and a blast, came in and slept like babies! turn on the AC fan. Across the street is the best donut shop ever!! This is a crash pad.

the stay was 12/24 to 12/28 so we could visit our Marine Grandson, wife and daughter-great granddaughter.  The rate was very good, the room was large, very clean. third floor (301) corner was good. All non-smoking.  The Inn is at least 25 years old, but has character, has been kept up nicely without taking away the design. The only issue I have is that the deck for each floor, nice, but allows the cig smoke to filter into the rooms. one smoking guest came down to our end and smoked and smoked. We had to leave for a while! The owners are very proud of their Inn and rightly so

We stayed on the 2nd floor. Close to the freeway but the windows keep the sound out which was perfect. Staff members are great! Providing excellent service. Room was really cool. Has this beachy theme to it. The only thing I wish is it was walking distance to the beach. But san clemente is a hilly town so we had to drive unless we wanted to hike up a mountain to get back to our room

üòÑüòÑ  we really loved our two night stay room was clean ...  It was our first time in san Clemente & it was a nice experience its not far from the beach .... The pier was very close by .... If we come again we plan to stay here again üòÄüòÉüòÑ

Stayed in this place for 8 days and I have only 2 real negatives and they would be small ones at that. First the place isn‚Äôt real ‚Äúby the beach‚Äù, it‚Äôs more ‚Äúa decent jog to the beach‚Äù but to be honest it was dead cheap so I couldn‚Äôt care!  Me and my brother stayed here for the first part of our road trip on the west coast and were a little bit unsure of the place when we arrived. However when we got into the room we were really impressed. The room was the biggest we stayed in for our whole trip (including LA & Vegas).   Shower, utilities etc all worked perfectly while the beds were big and comfy. The breakfast was slightly minimal but there‚Äôs 2 places across the road that are good for food. Other than that I would say maybe get a room on the top floor ‚Äì there were kids there

I came with family and we got two different rooms. Both with 2 beds, both the beds smelled clean and the linens were nice and crisp. In both rooms the bathrooms were also clean and with extra towels. One of the things i really loved about this hotel is that they have kinda like an outdoor patio where you can enjoy your lunch or just chat with people.   The staff member that served us was a younge man and he was very nice and attentive, I did enjoy that they have a section of DVDs you can rent out for the night and the office if open 24hrs so you can easily get another one. The only reason why i would not give this Hotel 5 * is only because i really would of wished they had a better breakfast selection.

My room was extremely dirty, not even clean. The shower didn't work and when I told the guy who gave me the keys he keeps repeating "you should have checked out the room yourself then told me." Like it's my job to do that. I ended up getting another room where there were Cobb webs everywhere and the door luck didn't even work. I would add pictures of the filth and the video of the shower/door not working but I don't see an upload spot.

Summary Heading: Great stay in a cute boutique motel!
Summary: We loved our stay at this charming little motel. It's older...but nicely decorated and clean. Comfortable King bed room on the third floor gave us a wonderful view of the ocean. Scanty complimentary breakfast but there is a donut shop with nice pastries across the street as well. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. We got a great price and would stay here again!! They even have books to share...got a new best seller!!

This place was a complete disappointment. My feet were black after walking from the shower to the bed to get dressed. Ridiculously noisy next to the highway and elephants above my room. Everything felt grimy and gross. Only one lock on the door that leads to outside. No privacy curtains so if you want sunlight during the day, everyone can see right in your room. It was just disgusting. I booked for 4 nights and checked out after the first night. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.

Welcoming...excellent, convienience...excellent- parking secure, bed very comfortable, safe, secure, in a great city. Very close to all that San Clemente has to offer. The owners take great pride in insuring your stay is enjoyable.  Overall a good place to stay.

Summary Heading: Comfy King bed with great puffy pillows and an ideal sleep
Summary: Stayed one night here and enjoyed the hotel for its location and value. If you're looking for a good sleep then this hotel will not disappoint. The king size bed is so comfortable and the room is spotless and fresh.Would consider another sleepover for the comfort factor.

this is a mom and pops run hotel, they are very tight with the continental breakfast, there are only three muffins and pastries put out in the morning so if you want seconds or someone else gets them before you, your out of luck. there is no sitting area in the breakfast area it is just a small table set up close to the counter where you check inn so they can keep a close eye on how much a person takes to there room.There is a bagel place across the street which i think they secretly wish everyone would go to instead of eating there breakfast.The parking is very tight. The room is outdated the bed is not a pillow top very basic and not comfortable, the bathroom needed to be cleaner had some mold in the floors around the tub. I would not go back.They are very tight with there

First of all, this hotel is not by the beach.  It's at least a mile away from a beach.  We got an 'ocean view' room, which we could just see in the distance over the highway wall.  It was mainly a highway view.  On the plus side, the room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  The owners obviously try very hard to add some extra touches, like the DVD player and snack basket.  The continental breakfast looked decent, but we decided to go to the SC Cafe across the street, which was excellent.  The location is right off the highway, but not within walking distance to anything interesting in town.  If we go back to San Clemente, we'll probably try someplace else.

Nice room, cabinet for tv very large, decor like tropical island. Bed good. Staff friendly although night staff said they would get back to me so I could make local call, they never got back to me? Good budget motel. Would stay again. Donuts across the the road at surfin donuts excellent. Sonnys restaurant well worth visit, just down road.

When we hit the end of a day of poking about the back country south of LA, this hotel practically found us.  Just a moment off the coast highway we saw the quaint old-styled place tucked back in a corner.  Clearly geared for the surfing and beach walking art crowds, it drew us in from the start.  The low prices and clean fully appointed rooms kept us there.  We were pleased that the highway noise was minimal, and the rooms spacious. Sure, it is an older place, and shows it, but its charm remains and the young staff are friendly and helpful.

Easy to find and a good location for touring up and down the coast.  We asked for and got a third floor ocean view over the freeway, but quiet with the doors & windows closed. The staff was very accommodating, we had to move the 3rd night due to a leak from the rain.  The room is nicely decorated, and comfortable.  We walked to the pier the first evening, kind of a wandering walk, it was more direct walking back up Del Mar then El Camino Real.  We didn't experience the continental breakfast because we were up and out with an early start, we did enjoy the in room coffee maker (had to ask for 2 packets as only 1 was supplied).  The soda machine was stocked with lots of choices for only $1 each,  I'm glad we had a smaller car cause the parking is a little tight.

Summary Heading: A Little Diamond in San Clemente!
Summary: We had the opportunity to stay for six nights at this hotel over the Thanksgiving holiday.  Well kept, clean, and even had a view of the ocean.  The management was friendly, continental breakfast enough to get us started in the morning and the location was very convenient.  Loved the bed!  Had a microwave and frig so didn't have to eat out all the time.  Very reasonably priced and so much better than the budget motels/hotels!    The only drawback, but also a plus, is that it is right of the I-5, so you hear the traffic, but if you need to get somewhere, the location is convenient.  As for the traffic noise, once you are in your room, it was fine and the highway noise did not bother us.    We will stay here again when we pass through San Clemente!

This is an old school style motel with a great design, but it does show some age. I went there with 3 other guys for a guys weekend at the beach and we had a blast. The balcony layout is really cool and we had our door open most of the time we were at the place hanging out on the balcony. The view from the higher floors is ok and you can see the ocean, but not really from the 2nd floor. The staff and owners are very nice and do what they can to make your stay a good one. The rooms were clean enough for me, but I'm sure if my wife was with me she would have found something to complain about. We did have to ask for extra towels and soap, but other than that no issues.  Some comments: The parking is tight, but that is too be expected in a beach town.  There is a propane BBQ free

The white duvet, fluffy pillows, granite counter top, covered free parking, new tiled bathrooms and sunset view were pleasant surprises.  I was on a staycation while I had company at my pad and just wanted a place that I could walk to restaurants, ride my bike from to the beach trail along the ocean and have a fridge/microwave.   The room was clean. I utilized the Free Wi Fi, in room snacks and on premise BBQ grill.  The rooms at the beach are pricey.  The National chain hotel which was closer to downtown (8 minute walk) was $189 for the same night I paid $73 here and didn't include breakfast or WI Fi.    I hit several really nice restaurants in a two block radius including El Mariachi and Happa J's. I enjoyed the walk to the beach and loved the convenient access to the highway

My husband and I travel to visit friends in San Clemente two or three times a year and we always stay here.  The rooms are spacious and always clean.  Traffic noise is minimal and everything is within easy walking and/or driving distance.  Staff is friendly and courteous, plus the outdoor balcony/patio is perfect for afternoon wine/appetizers to hare with friends.....

Summary Heading: Lots of pluses, but needs work.
Summary: Close to freeway but good sound proofing except when children were running upstairs. We had a few issues which the owners did their best to resolve. They gave us a discount for the things they couldn't fix. The coffee was good, but nothing especially exciting for the continental breakfast. One car parking per room. Close to beach, town, restaurants and shopping.

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For
Summary: My wife and I traveled to San Clemente to attend my nephew's wedding on the beach. We only stayed there the one night, fortunately. The one-bed room was clean and of average size. There was a small refrigerator that was noisy enough at night to make getting to sleep a little difficult and a microwave we did not use. There is no central AC/Heat but there is a wall unit you would have to run constantly to avoid opening the old single pane window because of the traffic noise from the close-by freeway. My wife says they should name it "The Little Inn By The Freeway".  Parking is very limited and tight. A notice posted in the elevator warns that if you park at any of the nearby businesses you car will be towed. Don't do that. When we returned from the reception at around 11:00 pm

The only thing this hotel has going for it is that it is right off the freeway. Having said that, it is RIGHT OFF THE FREEWAY. Sitting out on the patio enjoying the weather is ruined by the constant drone of vehicles passing by.  The one ice machine serving all 3 floors was routinely empty. The remote for our TV was missing its back and the battery fell out. We couldn't change volume or channel all night until it was programmed again. The girl at the front desk got us what we needed, but didn't seem happy about it. The rooms are extremely dated as well. If you are only looking for a bed to sleep in, come here. If you expect a bit more, look elsewhere.

My son and I recently stayed here for 3 days while on college visits in LA/San Diego. It was very convenient to get between both cities, and the rooms were comfortable and a good price. However...parking was free on the property, but crowded; the "continental breakfast" was some granola bars, a few apples and bananas, and small, packaged bagels - walk across the street to Surfin Donuts or the cafe, both were great. It was only a short drive to the beach or pier which was nice. Overall it was a good place when on a budget and not planning to be in the hotel much anyway.

I recently stayed here with my family of 5. Loved, loved, loved this place! Excellent rooms, great location in orange county, fantastic beach access. Inn is older, but we found it quite charming. I hope to be near this area again to use this inn in the future.

This was a good deal!  It's not on the beach and the ocean view also has a highway before you see the ocean.  If you don't mind a 2 minute drive to Del Mar Dr. (take a left and park in beach parking) this is the place for you!  It's not new and doesn't have any amenities but it's a good price for a place to sleep.  We stayed in the 2 queen bed room and the beds were soft but comfy.  There was a microwave,minifridge, tv.  We were at the beach the whole time and only used the minifridge for soda and water though. If you're looking for a place with a nice continental breakfast you won't like this it's just granola bars and bagels.  but across the street is Surfin Doughnuts- worth being in walking distance great local place!!! I really had fun here but mostly liked it for the price

After having a bad experience at a 4 star hotel in Oceanside, on the night of our wedding, we decided to try and make up for it in San Clemente. We had spent a rediculious amount of money on the room in Oceanside that didnt turn out so good, so we were on a budget. And when you arent spending much, you most certainly cant expect much, but at the little Inn by the beach everything was just great for us! The room was about $70 and the gal at the front desk was very kind. I got a little scared when she handed me the room key and it had room # 303. That was the room # we were in the night before at the other hotel and that turned out not so good!  But to our surprise the room was just perfect for us. So CLEAN and very nice style. I am such a germaphobe, but I couldnt have felt more

Summary Heading: Don't expect a Hilton and you won't be disappointed!
Summary: When my fiance was stationed at Camp Pendleton near San Clemente, I came to visit him as often as possible. Seeing as I am paying my own way through college, I needed to find a hotel in SC that wouldn't bankrupt me. I am SO glad we found this place, because even though it isn't the pinnacle of amazingness, it was more than enough for us.   The bed was comfortable (pillows too!), the sink was in good repair, and as far as I know there is at least 1 parking spot per hotel room. The management, although not overly friendly, was not intrusive or mean either, and the hotel is so close to the beach that it feels like a steal to get it for way less than $100 per night.   Because honestly, who goes to San Clemente, California and stays in their hotel room all day long? Take it for what
Not as many amenities as mainstream hotels but a great little place with lots of atmosphere. Great staff and a very nice room as well. The name is a bit deceiving; it's not on the beach.

We are visited our family in San Clemente for a number of years and found the Little Inn to be the best place we've stayed and now the only place we want to stay.  We love the family atmosphere, friendly service and overall warm, comfort of the place.  We are very happy with the overall appearance and cleanliness of the rooms, most important to me, a comfortable bed!  It is by far the best value in the area.  We've stayed in the spring and the latest stay was during Christmas.  The housekeeping team was there even on Christmas day!  When we needed extras (coffee, shampoo, towels, etc.) it was just a matter of letting someone know.We love the Little Inn!

Meticiously maintained, this older property was a delight to stay in.  We arrived earlier than our check in time.  The pleasant and courteous office manager said she would check to see if our room was ready.  Fortunately, it was and we settled in.  Yes, we did hear the freeway traffic, but it did not disturb our sleep.  We have relatives in the San Clemente area, so we plan on returning to this "little gem", often.

Summary Heading: I will NEVER stay here again
Summary: I booked this room over the internet from across the country.  I had several close friends that are marines deploying, so flew across the country to be with them.  When I got there, the (tiny) parking lot was full, so I had to park my rental car down the street.  The cost totaled $426.  This is what I received for that $426.  I had booked a room with 2 beds but was told that they didnt have any left and so we got one bed.  All of the rooms are nonsmoking.  This means that if any of us wanted to smoke we had to go outside.  This is fine except that I guess the noise carries.  We were not even being loud at all when the management came up several times to ask us to not be outside.  And that was only the first night.  The second night, we were outside again smoking, with the door

Summary Heading: The best budget motel in the area
Summary: I have stayed at the Little Inn many times over the years and have always been amazed at the quality of the room you get for such a low price. This isn't a full service hotel by any means, but it is a nice comfortable room for half the price you would pay at a holiday inn. When my husband was stationed at camp pendleton 5 years ago I stayed here many times visiting him. I also tried many of the other motels close to the base entrance. The Little Inn blows the rest of the motels out of the water. This past spring, I traveled back here with my daughter for a friends wedding and was pleased to find that it was still just a great as I had remembered. This is a great base for exploring the area. And if you want a great cheap breakfast, do like the surfers do, and check out La

Summary Heading: beach??????? little inn not by the beach
Summary: we rented this hotel thinking it was close to the beach, but no, its a perfect view of the freeway. I mean we are visitors to san clemente and it didnt mention on website it was by a freeway and not to mention the breakfast was low quality although the rooms were clean.

Summary Heading: I didn't get what I expected -- or paid for.
Summary: My daughter and her family was hosting the Christmas get-together this year,  She lives right up the hill from The Little Inn at the Beach and I had seen how attractive it looks, so I booked a three-night stay there to ease the overcrowding at my daughter's house.  I was there from Wednesday, December 23, till check-out the morning of Saturday, December 26, 2009.  The room was very clean and pleasant, though basic.    Like all the rooms, it has a nice west-facing view of the ocean.    The motel advertises that all the rooms are non-smoking.   However -- and this is was a big how-ever for me -- the doors of all the rooms open onto  a terrace or veranda outside each level, and the windows of each room are right on the terrace.   On the terraces are tables with chairs and ashtrays,

Summary Heading: The perfect hotel for beach going!
Summary: This hotel is perfect!  Great price and awesome staff, maybe family owned.  May not be your 5 star hotel(little dated), but clean rooms with everything you need.  Rooms have miniature fridge and microwave, which is great when you have kiddos.  The perfect hotel for beach going.  (It is not walking distance to beach, however there is plenty of parking for a low fee.)  Great room for kids and very roomy.  Breakfast is nice too.  Not the hot breakfast with waffles & eggs, but they offer bagels, toast,coffee and an array of items from Costco or somewhere similar.  Juice boxes, breakfast bars, fresh fruit, etc.  Will definitely come back !

Bottom line, you can't beat the price for a no-frills place to lay your head in a great beach town. Don't ask me how this place is only $75-90/night when a Motel 6 in a ghetto costs more.  WARNING: High-maintenance, pretencious snobs will NOT like this place. They expect the Ritz for $80. Fine soliders are dying for their freedom and they whine about needing a fancy toilet that  shoots water to clean their undercarriage?   I digress. This place is simple, practical, and minutes from laid-back beach frolic. A few things to know: 1) Despite the name of the hotel, it's not a short walk to the main beach, so most will drive. 2) Any big SUV will barely fit in the small parking spots. 3) The continental breakfast takes a minimilist approach -- looks like they go to 7-11 every morning

Summary Heading: Fine for what it is, but not a deluxe place
Summary: It is an $80/night place.  If you expect a $150/night room, you will be disappointed.  If you want a cheap place to sleep in San Clemente, it's fine.  The good:  -Close to the beach -San Clemente is a nice town -Rooms are clean enough  The bad: -Close to the freeway (noise) -A little dingy -Deadbolt was weak- not the most secure room but in San Clemente I wouldn't be that worried -The bed was really soft -Towel had cigarette burns

This place is a hidden gem. The price was extremely affordable and the service is by far the nicest.  The place is nice and clean and smells nice,too. The also have a 75 cents vending machine downstairs for thirsty times. When was the last time you've seen anything in vending machines that cost 75 cents?! Hello......like, 10 years ago! But this place isn't trying to rip you off. IT is cozy and I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Absolutely LOVE this little place ... cozy, friendly & close to beach!
Summary: Very friendly staff and they are flexible and accommodating.  Cute little Inn with 3 levels ... all levels have patio tables and chairs with an umbrella.  It's great to have free WI FI for our laptop computers and the little fridge is just right along with the microwave which is very handy for us.  We stayed 4 nights last week and really enjoyed it so booked another 4 nights for this week.  I only wish they started the breakfast earlier than 8:30am since we need to leave early each morning and don't get a chance to enjoy it.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Little Inn by the Beach.  It was cute with its beachy theme and they just got new carpet.  The staff was friendly.  The continental breakfast  was just coffee, juice, fruit, packaged muffins and danish but it was a great start to our mornings before we went to the beach.  It was the cleanest hotel we have been to in this area.  I would stay there again.

The Little Inn by the Beach has a great location and that's where it ends.  The parking lot has spaces for the size of a Yugo.  The door to your room will surely stick and really good.  The hot water to your sink will appear after you run the water for 10 minutes.  This is a environmental (green) facility??  It will take 2 days to get a light bulb changed.  The carpet is sure to be stained.  The front door is sure to be dirty as well as the interior trim around the windows and door.  You may or may not receive maid service.  The best aspect of the Inn is the location which is very good.  It is a great place if you do not spend any time in your room.
